product_name: Kosas Color & Light: Crème Cream Blush & Highlighter Duo
user_specs: ['Eye Color Green', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Olive', 'Skin Type Dry']
review_title: Very unnatural look and not a good consistency
review_content:
This honestly sort of feels like a children's pretend makeup product from the dollar store. It's really too bad because I was excited about trying this brand. The consistency is really not great to use your fingers because its completely soft and way too much product goes onto your finger even with the lightest swipe. The shimmer in the highlighter has really visible glitter in it which doesn't make for good look in my opinion, very unnatural. Also the pink shade is very pigmented which I guess is great if thats what you're after but not fun to try and create a natural blush look. Will not be buying again.

product_name: Kosas Color & Light: Crème Cream Blush & Highlighter Duo
user_specs: ['Eye Color Green', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Olive', 'Skin Type Normal']
review_content:
Happy I got this! I actually was back and forth between the high intensity and "regular" intensity color before I purchased. I'm glad I got the high intensity because it goes on a deep color but once you mix it then it blends into your skin without looking like you have red red cheeks. It's super creamy too and has a slight shimmer. I mix both colors together. Like a sun kissed glow I find. Only have used it for a couple days so I'm unsure of how long it lasts after a full day but it's very pretty and not sticky even when I'm sweating here in 25 degree weather in Canada! ☀️ my skin is a light olive and this color isn't too pink for me. It's a great shade

product_name: Kosas Color & Light: Crème Cream Blush & Highlighter Duo
user_specs: ['Eye Color Hazel', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content: I really want to love this product. It's buildable, the color is beautiful, and the highlighter isn't strobey at all, which I prefer. But the fact that it makes my skin an absolute oil slick makes it unwearable. This is even when I powder on top. It somehow seems to spread out and make my entire face look drenchy in oil. I don't have oily skin, but it's not dry either.

product_name: Kosas Color & Light: Crème Cream Blush & Highlighter Duo
user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Tan', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content: The texture of this cream blush is very nice. Initially I wanted to pick a different color thinking tropic equinox, however it works perfectly well with my skin color and yellow tone. Maybe because of the oils it has a peculiar smell, but is not overwhelming.

product_name: Kosas Color & Light: Crème Cream Blush & Highlighter Duo
user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content:
Love love love these cream blush & highlights. I went through and entire Tropic Equiox which I used as a blush/bronzer since I am quite fair. The highlight in that one is more champagne which was my preferred highlight. I recently bought Velvet Melon during the Spring Sale and I love how juicy & pastel the colour is. The name Velvet Melon is the perfect description of the product. The photos on Sephoras website are not accurate so I highly suggest googling swatches. The highlight in Velvet Melon is more pinky VS the champagne in tropic equinox. Another thing that was very interesting was that the shelf life span of my Tropic Equinox was 6 months where as my new Velvet Melon is 18 months. I don't know if they have changed the formula or if they are different depending on the shade ingredients, but it is something to keep in mind. You do have to use creams up faster than powders but these are such beautiful formulas.

product_name: Kosas Color & Light: Crème Cream Blush & Highlighter Duo
user_specs: ['Eye Color Gray', 'Hair color Blonde', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Normal']
review_title: Lovely Cream Blush and Highlight Option
review_content:
I tend to go for blushes that are bronzy or neutral because I find they look the most natural and flattering on my fair/light skin. The blush is a lovely peachy bronze with some very fine shimmer. The shimmer isn’t chunky or sparkly in any way, which I am very particular about. The highlight is is a light peach with fine shimmer. The textures of the two products are a bit different- the blush has a bit more stiffness and the highlight is softer and seems to melt right away when you touch it. I have applied them with my fingers, a synthetic brush and a sponge and I definitely prefer to blend out with a brush or sponge. The longevity is surprisingly good. I don’t find that these disappear before my base.

I tend to go for a more natural makeup look and this fits right in with that aesthetic. product_name: Kosas Color & Light: Crème Cream Blush & Highlighter Duo
user_specs: ['Age 25-34', 'Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Black', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_title: Color is beautiful, but not for me.
review_content:
The color is beautiful and looked like the perfect soft blush I wanted for my more simple makeup look. The packaging is also very pretty and sleek and came with a large mirror. I really wanted to like this after seeing so many fantastic reviews. It seemed like such a simple product to use and based on the videos and pictures I saw, i had the impression that this would be very soft and creamy and thought it would be kind of like softened butter. However, the color just didn't show up. I use Tone 5 and this barely showed up. I had to use quite a lot of product to get a decent amount of color and it didn't even last more than a couple hours. The highlighter looked chunky when I looked in the mirror up close, but from far away, it didn't even look like i applied highlighter. The product was also very sticky (so not like the softened butter I had hoped for!), but it was easy to blend at least. It also had this weird gritty texture (which I did see some people saying they had the same observations). Anyway, maybe I'll give another color a second chance, but will be waiting until the Sephora stores reopen to go see them in-person.
…read more

product_name: Kosas Color & Light: Crème Cream Blush & Highlighter Duo
user_specs: ['Age 35-44', 'Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Dry']
review_content:
I have all three shades that Sephora sells in this duo, there is another shade that is only available on the brands actual website that I plan on picking up as well. This is one of my all time favorite cream products out there, every single shade is gorgeous and the formula is consistent with all of them. If you're new to cream products then I think this would be a great place to start, it is foolproof. I normally start off applying the blush with my fingers and then go over it with a stippling brush to smooth out the edges and make it more seamless. I know the colors can look intimidating in the pans, but once applied to the cheeks and sheered out they look gorgeous. The highlight is just a true wet looking highlight, no glitter or shimmer in them at all, just a gorgeous glowy look and they just blend in effortlessly. Some cream products are tricky to work with because they can lift the makeup up underneath, but these do not do that at all, I have even applied these over powder and it worked that way too. Both the blush and the highlight are super dewy and don't completely dry down, they do stay just a bit tacky, but not uncomfortable and sticky, so if you have super oily skin then I don't know how well you will like this. I love that they came out with an intense version so people with deeper skin tones can enjoy this product as well, although, even the regular shades can be built up enough where I think they would work with deeper skin tones, but I am very fair so I can't say for sure. The first duo that I bought months ago was Velvet Melon and it is still the exact same formula as the day I opened it, it did not dry out at all. These are pricey for what they are, but I truly think that these are worth every single dollar and if you love cream products or want to start dipping your toes in then this would be a great place to start.
…read more

product_name: Kosas Color & Light: Crème Cream Blush & Highlighter Duo
user_specs: ['Eye Color Green', 'Hair color Blonde', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Dry']
review_content:
The most gorgeous dewy glow. I have the Charlotte Tilbury beach stick in Las Salinas ( which is a cool Pink with a gold micro shimmer ). I was looking for a replacement product because I wanted to try something new. I have loved the Kosas lipsticks , so I thought I would try their cream blush as it’s gotten quite a bit of positive hype. The colour is everything ( 8th Muse ) is a dusty pinky rose colour , but the effect on the cheeks is like you went for a run and got all flushed. If you’re oilier skin you may not love this as it’s not going to dry down or sink into the cheeks. It does remain dewy and somewhat tacky on the cheeks. But I don’t feel greasy when I wear it. The highlighter is very subtle , so for those who don’t like a ton of highlighter , it would be a great option. For me I like to add a little bit of a powder highlight on top, a good one to pair with it is Tarte Stunner, as it’s a soft champagne pink tone. Anyway , if you love dewy glowy youthful skin , try this out. You can always apply a powder blush on top which I have done as well.

I still stand by my decision, however I feel like regular version of this duo would have been slightly easier to blend. I have to work a little to diffuse the blush, but I don’t mind it. The highlight compliments everything perfectly. It makes me dewy, not shimmery. I’d buy this in different shades for sure!

review_content: I have been wanting to try this product for so long and I finally decided to buy it. The colors are beautiful swatched on my hand, but the blush doesn’t show up well enough on my skin and it’s a bit too warm toned. I love the highlighter though! Gorgeous.

product_name: Kosas Color & Light: Crème Cream Blush & Highlighter Duo
user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Blonde', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Oily']

product_name: Kosas Color & Light: Crème Cream Blush & Highlighter Duo
user_specs: ['Eye Color Hazel', 'Hair color Black', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content:
I cannot love Kosas any more than I already do. This formula glides on, blends like a dream. Both the blush and highlight are great. It wears beautifully during the day. Doesn’t fade. I didn’t realize when I purchased this that I got the 8th muse HIGH intensity. That was my mistake, and they really do mean high intensity. I’m fairly pale skinned though and I can still make this work. You honestly need the bare minimum of product to get incredible payoff. I find my fingers are the best application tool. I find some cream cheek products seem to just sit on top of my skin and feel heavy. This is the perfect formula for a cream that delivers long wear and great pigmentation but feels light and looks like a natural flush. Next time I will probably just purchase the lower pigmentation version of this. For darker skin tones this would be a killer shade.

product_name: Kosas Color & Light: Crème Cream Blush & Highlighter Duo
user_specs: ['Age 25-34', 'Eye Color Green', 'Hair color Blonde', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content: Okay so I got this for its high pigment in the summer to enhance my tan but I gave it a try now (it's winter here and I am extremely pale) I am amazed that something with such high pigment can be blended to give a subtle glow and contour...I can imagine it would be even better with an actual base tan. Glowy summer goddess here I come!!!

product_name: Kosas Color & Light: Crème Cream Blush & Highlighter Duo

review_content:

I like to apply with a damp sponge and tap off on the back of my hand first. It blends out so well. I especially love the highlighter. I usually apply that with my finger. I don’t need to set them with any powder. Gives my cheeks such a gorgeous flush. Lasts well throughout the day. I did try the highlighter as a cream shadow and it didn’t dry down + creased horribly, so I cant recommend using it that way.

product_name: Kosas Color & Light: Crème Cream Blush & Highlighter Duo

review_content:

The creamy texture blends well on the skin and provides my deep skin tone with a natural flush. I have never found a good highlight that I repeatedly lean toward and love the natural luminosity that this one provides. It does have a tiny bit of glitter that I notice as the day progresses, which I don't love because I'm not a glitter person. BUT, I love the highlight so much that it does not deter me from using at all! Ihave received many compliments on my skin after using this product. I'll repeat, my skin NOT my makeup. This product helps to achieve a natural and healthy glow. I highly recommend.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Dry']
review_content: This is a lovely cream blush. Like other reviewers have mentioned, it goes on very smooth and it so easy to blend in. This colour looks very natural which I like. product_name: Kosas Color & Light: Crème Cream Blush & Highlighter Duo
user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Normal']
review_title: Go For It, Less Pigmented Than Pictured
review_content:
This is my first Kosas product and I’m not disappointed. I prefer cream products for their natural finish and this product is very, very natural. Compared to other cream blushes and face colors I’ve used in the past, it’s one of the most smooth and blendable (most akin to RMS than, say, Stila). It doesn’t require any pulling at the skin and isn’t sticky, thanks to what feels like a low melting point (I also wouldn’t leave it in the car). Both the blush and highlight are mildly glossy, but not distractingly so, and the highlight is flattering even if it looks darker than your typical choice. I was uncertain choosing between Velvet Melon and its High Intensity counterpart. After using, I’m still just slightly unsure as the melon shade is nearly undetectable (and I’m a pretty pale person). If you like to add dimension by layering a more vibrant color to the apple of the cheek, this product provides a really good base and serves as a subtle, no-makeup product on other days. As someone who tends to be light-handed on the first pass but somehow always overdoes the second, I like this as a foolproof product for a natural look or paired with bold lips or eyes.

product_name: Kosas Color & Light: Crème Cream Blush & Highlighter Duo
user_specs: ['Eye Color Green', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Normal']
review_title: Amazing product but product design needs work
review_content:
I bought this in Tropic Equinox after reading the reviews and checking out some swatches, and I can honestly say I'm not disappointed! I'm very fair with freckles, and I love adding a bit of natural warmth to my cheeks. I find I can actually pull off putting a bit on the lower section of my cheekbones and the high points of my face, and it looks extremely natural and flattering. I usually have to use two different products for that, but it somehow works here. The highlighter is also great, but not my favourite part of the duo. I love the blush enough that I'll give this 5 stars, but I was close to knocking off a star because of the product design. Kosas really needs to sell individuals; either pan replacements or solo products. I'm less inclined to buy another creme blush duo because I already have the highlighter, and when I run out of this blush there's no way I'll be out of the highlighter I already have. Kosas, please, you're getting an amazing brand following due to your wonderful products, but we need more versatility in the design in order to fully experience the line (and not feel bad about product waste).
…read more

user_specs: ['Eye Color Hazel', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Dry']
review_title: Don't waste your money and your time
review_content: This product is definitely overrated. Upon initial application, it does look pretty, but the blush fades almost immediately. Also, the product needs to be used within 3 months since it's cream based, so that's something else to keep in mind. I would not recommend.

product_name: Kosas Color & Light: Crème Cream Blush & Highlighter Duo
user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Black', 'Skin Tone Tan', 'Skin Type Dry']
review_content:
Wonderful, clean product! I find myself using it every time I want blush instead of my all time favorite from Bobbi Brown blush that I’ve stayed loyal to for about 10 years now (even though I’ve tried many others over the years). The color looks very bright but you can blend it down to your own preference. I love it and wish it came in more colors. The highlighter is very subtle but you can build it up from super light to possibly medium coverage. If you want to be seen from the moon, this highlighter might not be for you. Lol. I also love that it doesn’t give that cake-y finish most other powder highlighters give. All in all, great product! Will buy again once I finish this.
